derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from medieval Latin domesticat- 'domesticated', from the verb domesticare, from Latin domesticus 'belonging to the house' (see domestic)

entry.def: When people domesticate wild animals or plants, they bring them under control and use them to produce food or as pets.

example.ex: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
example.tran: 我们驯狗来帮我们打猎。

example.ex: ...sheep, cattle, horses, and other domesticated animals.
example.tran: 羊、牛、马及其他驯养的动物

means.word_mean: 1. adapt (a wild plant or unclaimed land) to the environment;
2. overcome the wildness of; make docile and tractable;
3. make fit for cultivation, domestic life, and service to humans;

sentences.sentence: "The horse was domesticated a long time ago"
"The wolf was tamed and evolved into the house dog"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: ' I did master the principles of how to domesticate a man.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: "It takes a very long time to domesticate animals, " Shipman said.

auth_sentence.content: By castrating the dominant males, the herders are able to control and semi-domesticate the whole herd.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: By castrating the dominant males, the herders are able to control and semi-domesticate the whole herd.

stems_affixes.word_buile: dom屋,家+estic表形容词→家里的→驯养的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有统治权的,占优势的,支配的
stems_affixes.word_buile: domin=dom统治+ant→adj.有统治权的,占优势的,支配的
in不+dom统治+itable→不可统治的→不可征服的→坚强不屈的
pre在……前面+dominant支配的→adj.[over]占优势的;主要的,突出的
dom统治+ain表名词→统治的区域
domestic驯养的+ate表动词→v.驯养[动物]
dom统治+inate→v.支配,统治,控制;占优势

sentences.en: Cows were domesticated to provide us with milk.
sentences.cn: 人们饲养奶牛来为我们提供牛奶。

sentences.en: Many thousand years ago people learned how to domesticate animals.
sentences.cn: 数千年以前人们就学会了饲养动物。
